intro: Psychotria humboldtiana var. genuina, commonly known as the Humboldt's psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, particularly Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its dark green, glossy leaves and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, typically in montane forests. The plant is also notable for its alkaloid content, which has been studied for potential medicinal properties.
